post.summary: Add a new application to the catalog.

Deploy an application on a target Playground platform. This endpoint
will gather the application information and send it to the target
playground platform.
Download an application from the catalog.
Info returns the detail of a given application.
List the applications in the catalog.
Remove an application from the catalog.

application_id.title:
ApplicationId with the identifier of an application using the
same approach as docker:
[catalogURL/]namespace/appName[:tag]

file.title: Files with all the application files

private.title: Private with a flag to indicate if the application is private or not

catalogAddApplicationRequest.title: AddApplicationRequest with a request to add an application to catalog

application_default_name.title: ApplicationDefaultName with the application instance name by default

spec_components_raw.title: SpecComponentsRaw with the component specification in yaml format (parameters, traits, etc.)

catalogApplicationInstanceConfiguration.title: ApplicationInstanceConfiguration  with the configuration with wich the application will be deployed

applications.description: Applications returned as part of a given query.

catalogApplicationList.description: ApplicationList with a subset of application summaries.

src.description: Src with the URL to obtain the logo.

type.title: Type with the logo type (p.e: image/png)

catalogApplicationLogoList.title: ApplicationLogoList with a list of application logo

api_version.title: ApiVersion with the version of the metadata api

kind.title: Kind with the kind of the metadata

name.title: Name with the name of the application

version.title: Version with the version of the application

keywords.description: Keywords assocaited with the application. In the future, these keywords will facilitate searches.

doc.description: Doc with the application documentation URL.

catalogApplicationMetadata.description: ApplicationMetadata represents the metadata info as provided in the metadata.yaml file.

k8s.title: K8s with all the K8s entities needed

catalogApplicationRequirement.description:
ApplicationRequirement with the application requirements in terms of scopes,
traits or CRD that are required for the application to run.

namespace.description: Namespace where the application is located.

application_name.title: ApplicationName with the name of the application

tag_metadata_name.title: TagMetadataName associated with the catalog entry. MetadataName indexed by tag

catalogApplicationSummary.title: ApplicationSummary with a resume of an application

application_id.title:
ApplicationId with the identifier of an application using the
same approach as docker:
[catalogURL/]namespace/appName[:tag]

target_environment_qualified_name.description:
TargetEnvironmentQualifiedName specifying the target environment in the user
account as account_name/env_name.

target_playground_api_url.description: TargetPlaygroundAPIURL indicating the url to which redirect the request.

instance_configuration.description:
InstanceConfiguration with the configuration which the application will be deployed
indexed by the original application name. This approach enables the catalog to support
application packages that deploy more than one application.

catalogDeployApplicationRequest.description:
DeployApplicationRequest with the information required to send a
deploy request.

application_id.title:
ApplicationId with the identifier of an application using the
same approach as docker:
[catalogURL/]namespace/appName[:tag]

compressed.title: Compressed with a boolean to indicate if the response will be a tgz file or not

catalogDownloadApplicationRequest.title: DownloadApplicationRequest with the request to download an application

path.title: Path with the path of the file

catalogFileInfo.title: FileInfo represents all the information of an application file

application_id.title:
ApplicationId with the identifier of an application using the
same approach as docker:
[catalogURL/]namespace/appName[:tag]

catalogGetConfigurationRequest.title: GetConfigurationRequest with the information required to ask for an application configuration

is_application.title:
IsApplication with a flag to indicate if the catalog application contains an oam application or not
The user the might want store component definitions in the catalog and deploy them. In this case, 
the "appliation" in the catalog does no correspond to an oam application

application_default_name.title: ApplicationDefaultName with the application instance name by default

spec_components_raw.title: SpecComponentsRaw with the component specification in yaml format (parameters, traits, etc.)

application_id.title:
ApplicationId with the identifier of an application using the
same approach as docker:
[catalogURL/]namespace/appName[:tag]

catalogInfoApplicationRequest.title: InfoApplicationRequest with the request to ask for an application

namespace.description: Namespace where the application is located.

application_name.title: ApplicationName with the name of the application

tag.description: Tag associated with the catalog entry.

metadata_file.title: MetadataFile with the content of metadata file

readme_file.title: ReadmeFile with the content of app_config file

private.title: Private wit a flag to indicate if an application is private or not

catalogInfoApplicationResponse.title: InfoApplicationResponse with the response of an application

catalogKubernetesEntities.title: KubernetesEntities with the application K8s entities

namespace.description: Namespace indicates that the list operation will only affect a given namespace. This value is optional.

catalogListApplicationsRequest.description: ListApplicationsRequest with the options available when listing applications.

application_id.title:
ApplicationId with the identifier of an application using the
same approach as docker:
[catalogURL/]namespace/appName[:tag]

catalogRemoveApplicationRequest.title: RemoveApplicationRequest with the request to remove an application

num_namespaces.title: NumNamespaces with the number of users (namespaces) in the catalog

num_applications.title: NumApplications with the number of different applications

num_tags.title: NumTags wit the number of the different versions of applications

catalogSummaryResponse.title: SummaryResponse with a summary of the number of applications in the catalog

status_name.description: StatusName with the string representation of the status.

user_info.description: UserInfo with additional information to show to the user.

catalog_commonOpResponse.description:
OpResponse with a common definition for the result of executing an operation through gRPC. Notice that
in case of an error, the call must fail unless the operation is executed asynchronously and this
message contains the result of a past operation.

catalog_commonOpStatus.description:
OpStatus enumeration defining the possible status of an operation.

 - UNKNOWN: Unknown operation status indicates an error in the processing of the request as all operations should
have a determined status.
 - SUCCESS: Success indicates that the operation was completed successfully.
